result.execSummary:
The defendant Erick Earl Milan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.

AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety, random urine screening.

No alcohol or illegal drugs.
No new law violations that rise to level of probable cause.

Provide a DNA sample.
Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
Court set restitution at zero.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Erick Earl Milan

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Erick Earl Milan in court.  Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court for Erick Earl Milan.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin.
Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing. Additional statement by Ruby G.

Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, with credit for 0 days served. Huber for work and childcare. Court STAYED the sentence(s) and placed the defendant on probation for 2 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety, random urine screening.
- No alcohol or illegal drugs.
- Employment
- No new law violations that rise to level of probable cause.
- 6 months revocation of driver's license
- Provide a DNA sample. 

- Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.

- Court set restitution at zero.

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed: 
Letter to the Court
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief.

Defendant Erick Earl Milan in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Count 1: Pursuant to negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders charge dismissed, but read-in for sentencing purposes.

As to Count 2: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Defense motion to remove Justice Point monitoring not objected to by the State. Court grants and orders removal of monitoring. 

Sentencing hearing adjourned, BRanch 02.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

22RM022892  Actual Date Bond Posted with * Sheriff
4/26/2022
All previously ordered conditions of bail to remain the same.  No driving without a valid license. Defendant to make all future court appearances.

Defendant Erick Earl Milan in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held.  Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail $1,500.00. All previously ordered conditions of bail remain the same. Defense requests a plea hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 2.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Erick Earl Milan in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Erick Earl Milan in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Erick Earl Milan appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: City of Greenfield Police Officer Andrew Wroblewski.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court by video, defendant Erick Earl Milan not in court, in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defendant is unavailable due to a medical appointment. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 SUPERVISION.

Defendant Erick Earl Milan in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Erick Earl Milan in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Erick Earl Milan appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.    Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Erick Earl Milan
Current: 3801 W Ramsey Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53221   (Effective: 02-27-2022)
Prior: 4951 South 13th Street, #3, Milwaukee, WI 53221
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Erick Earl Milan not in court.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/24/22 @ 2p
